recipes.name: Pancakes
recipes.subtitle: A classic American breakfast treat. Totally suitable for dessert.

ingredients.ing6: 1 ½ cups milk (plus up to 1/4 cup extra if needed)

recipe.step1: Combine together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a large-sized bowl. Make a well in the center and add the milk, slightly cooled melted butter, vanilla and egg.
recipe.step2: Use a wire whisk to whisk the wet ingredients together first before slowly folding them into the dry ingredients. Mix together until smooth. The batter will be thick and creamy in consistency. If you find the batter too thick (doesn't pour off the ladle or out of the measuring cup smoothly) fold a couple tablespoons of extra milk into the batter at a time until reaching desired consistency).
recipe.step3: Set the batter aside and allow to rest while heating up your pan or griddle.
recipe.step4: Heat a nonstick pan or griddle over low-medium heat and wipe over with a little butter to lightly grease pan. Pour ¼ cup of batter onto the pan and spread out gently into a round shape with the back of your ladle or measuring cup. When the underside is golden and bubbles begin to appear on the surface, flip with a spatula and cook until golden. Repeat with remaining batter.

recipes.name: Crepes
recipes.subtitle: The thin French pancake. Can also be a dessert.

ingredients.ing3: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter , melted and slightly cooled
ingredients.ing6: ½ teaspoon fine sea salt or table salt
ingredients.ing7: 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour , sifted if desired

recipe.step1: In a blender, blend milk, eggs, butter, sugar, vanilla, salt, and flour 15 to 20 seconds, or until batter is smooth. You could also whisk in a bowl. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes, or overnight.
recipe.step2: Heat an 8-inch frying pan over medium-low heat. Pour about 1/4 cup batter into the pan, tilting pan immediately from side to side to form an even circle. Cook about 1 minute per side, or until lightly browned. Remove from heat and stack until ready to serve. Repeat with remaining batter.
recipe.step3: Serve with your favorite toppings. Fresh fruit, jams, pudding, nutella, whipped topping and nuts are a few of our favorites.

recipes.name: Burrito Bowl
recipes.subtitle: Nutritious and delicious.

recipe.step2: Saute the onion and garlic until tender. Stir in jalapeno and bell pepper. Set aside in a bowl.
recipe.step3: Mix in black beans and rice. Add salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Pineapple Ginger Smoothie
recipes.subtitle: Delicious and nutritious.

recipe.step1: Mix all ingredients together in a blender. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Brocolli Cheddar Quiche
recipes.subtitle: Who doesn't love quiche?

recipes.name: Gazpacho
recipes.subtitle: A cold, spicy tomato-based cold soup originated from Spain. Perfect for a hot summer day!

ingredients.ing2: ½ cup finely chopped red bell pepper

recipe.step1: Place all ingredients in blender. Blend until you have desired consistency

recipes.name: Ratatouille
recipes.subtitle: A classic French dish loaded with vegetables.

ingredients.ing1: 3/4 large (1 ¼ lbs.) eggplant, cut into 1/3-inch cubes
ingredients.ing2: 6 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for serving
ingredients.ing3: 3 medium zucchini (about 1 lbs.), cut into 1/3-inch cubes
ingredients.ing5: 1 red, orange or yellow bell pepper, cut into 1/4-inch dice
ingredients.ing7: 5 large vine-ripened tomatoes (1.75 lbs.), cut into 1/3-inch cubes, with their juices
ingredients.ing9: 2 teaspoons fresh chopped thyme, plus more for serving

recipe.step1: Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a large nonstick pan over medium heat. Add the eggplant and season with ¼ teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until soft and starting to brown, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
recipe.step2: Add another tablespoon of oil to the pan (no need to clean it). Add the zucchini and cook, stirring frequently, until tender-crisp, 3 to 4 minutes. Season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and transfer to a plate; set aside.
recipe.step3: Add two more tablespoons of oil to the pan and add the onion and bell pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, for about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and continue cooking for about 3 minutes more. Do not brown. Add the tomatoes and their juices, tomato paste, thyme, sugar, crushed red pepper flakes (if using) and 3/4 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are broken down into a sauce, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the cooked eggplant to the pan; bring to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to low, and simmer, uncovered, for about 10 minutes or until the eggplant is soft. Add the zucchini and cook for 1 to 2 minutes more, or until just warmed through.
recipe.step4: Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Sprinkle with fresh basil and thyme, drizzle with a little olive oil if desired, and serve warm or chilled. Leftovers can be stored in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

recipes.name: Sweet Potato Cauliflower Soup
recipes.subtitle: Sweet soup that hits the spot!

recipe.step1: Preheat oven to 400°F. Take 1 cup of the cauliflower and spread onto a baking sheet. Drizzle the 1 tsp of olive oil and a sprinkle of salt over the cauliflower - mix well. Spread the cauliflower out into one even layer and bake for 20 minutes. Shake the pan to toss the cauliflower around and bake another 5-10 minutes until the edges start to turn brown.
recipe.step2: In the meantime, in a soup pot over medium heat, sauté the diced onion in 1/4 cup vegetable broth until translucent - about 7-8 minutes. Add more vegetable broth as needed so the onions don't stick. Add the garlic, sage, paprika, and turmeric. Sauté 1 minute.
recipe.step3: Add the chopped sweet potato, cauliflower, and remaining vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then turn down heat to med-low and simmer for 20 minutes until the vegetable are fork tender.
recipe.step4: Using an immersion blender, purée the soup until smooth and creamy. (Alternately, you can carefully transfer the soup to a blender to purée.) Add the coconut milk and stir well. Taste and adjust seasonings, adding salt and pepper, if necessary. If you like a thinner soup, add a bit more vegetable broth or water.
recipe.step5: Serve in individual bowls garnished with a few roasted cauliflower florets.

recipes.name: Poke Bowl
recipes.subtitle: A healthy bowl of rice, raw fish, and Asian ingredients originated from Hawaii.

recipes.name: Venison Tacos
recipes.subtitle: Spicy, crunchy, mouth-watering tacos.

recipes.name: Salmon Sashimi Bowl
recipes.subtitle: A healthy bowl of rice, salmon, and Asian ingredients originated from Japan.

recipes.name: Vegan Pho
recipes.subtitle: A traditional Vietnamese noodle soup with a rich, flavorful broth.

ingredients.ing4: 1 large white onion*, peeled and quartered
ingredients.ing5: 4-inch piece of fresh ginger*, peeled and halved lengthwise
ingredients.ing6: 4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable stock or broth
ingredients.ing8: 2 tablespoons reduced-sodium tamari or soy sauce
ingredients.ing10: 1 tablespoon avocado oil, mild extra-virgin olive oil or your neutral-flavored oil of choice

recipe.step1: Warm a medium soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the cinnamon sticks, cloves, and star anise and toast until fragrant, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Add the onion and ginger – let sit for about 10 minutes or until onion and cinnamon sticks are slightly charred. Add vegetable stock, water and tamari. Raise the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Simmer for 30 minutes to give the flavors time to meld.
recipe.step2: In the meantime, press tofu to drain water and slice into 1” cubes. Cover in tamari sauce and let sit for 15-20 minutes. Lay out cubes into one sheet and toast for roughly 10 minutes.
recipe.step3: Prepare your rice noodles by cooking them according to package directions. Set them aside.
recipe.step4: To prepare the shiitake mushrooms, warm the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the mushrooms and a few dashes of salt. Cook until the mushrooms are tender and lightly browned, about 4 to 6 minutes, then set them aside.
recipe.step5: Once the broth is done cooking, strain out the onions, ginger and spices with colander into large pot/bowl. Add tofu and steamed broccoli to broth. Season it to taste with extra tamari and/or salt until the flavors of the spices really shine.

recipes.name: Baked Mac & Cheese
recipes.subtitle: Creamy, cheesy, classic baked mac and cheese that dreams are made of.

recipe.step3: Bring a large pot of water to the boil. Add macaroni and cook per packet directions, al dente. Drain, return pasta to pot, add butter and toss until melted. Set aside to cool while making the sauce.
recipe.step4: In a large saucepan or in an ovenproof skillet (I use my 26cm/9" Lodge cast iron skillet), melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Add about 1 cup of the milk and mix to dissolve the paste into the milk, then add remaining milk and mix until lump free (use whisk if required).
recipe.step5: Mix in seasonings. Cook, stirring/whisking regularly, for 5 - 8 minutes until thickened to a cream consistency. When the Sauce coats the back of a wooden spoon, you should be able to draw a path with your finger.
recipe.step6: Remove from stove, add cheese and stir - cheese doesn't need to melt. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
recipe.step7: Pour Sauce into pot with Macaroni. Stir quickly, then pour back into the skillet (I did this) or a baking dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumb topping. Bake for 25 minutes or until top is light golden.
recipe.step8: Sprinkle parsley over dish – serve immediately.

recipes.name: Elk Burgers
recipes.subtitle: A tasty classic with a wild twist.

recipes.name: Impossible Burgers
recipes.subtitle: A tasty classic with a vegan twist.

recipes.name: Tofu Banh Mi
recipes.subtitle: Marinated tofu in a classic Vietmase dish.

recipes.name: Vegan Chili
recipes.subtitle: Spicy chili loaded with vegetables. Perfect for a chilly day!

ingredients.ing11: 2 (4 oz) cans chopped green chili peppers, drained
ingredients.ing13: 3 (28 ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, crushed

recipe.step1: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the onion, and season with bay leaves, cumin, oregano, and salt. Cook and stir until onion is tender, then mix in the celery, green bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, garlic, and green chili peppers. When vegetables are heated through, mix in the vegetarian burger crumbles. Reduce heat to low, cover pot, and simmer 5 minutes.
recipe.step2: Mix the tomatoes into the pot. Season chili with chili powder and pepper. Stir in the kidney beans, garbanzo beans, and black beans. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 45 minutes.

recipes.name: Venison Chili
recipes.subtitle: Spicy venison chili loaded with vegetables. Perfect for a chilly day!

ingredients.ing11: 2 (4 oz) cans chopped green chili peppers, drained
ingredients.ing13: 3 (28 ounce) cans whole peeled tomatoes, crushed

recipe.step1: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the onion, and season with bay leaves, cumin, oregano, and salt. Cook and stir until onion is tender, then mix in the celery, green bell peppers, jalapeno peppers, garlic, and green chili peppers. Reduce heat to low, cover pot, and simmer 5 minutes.
recipe.step2: Mix the tomatoes into the pot. Season chili with chili powder and pepper. Stir in the kidney beans, garbanzo beans, and black beans. Mix in the sauteed venison.
recipe.step3: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 45 minutes.

recipes.name: Sea Salt Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.subtitle: A sweet and salty classic!

ingredients.ing2: ¾ cup light brown sugar, lightly packed

recipe.step1: Preheat oven to 375°. Line 3 sheet pans with parchment paper.
recipe.step2: In an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar on medium-high speed for 3 minutes, until light and fluffy. Scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula. On low speed, add the vanilla, then the eggs, one at a time. Scrape down the bowl again.
recipe.step3: Meanwhile, sift the flower, baking soda, and salt, and salt into a medium bowl. Mix in the oats. With the mixer on low, slowly ad the flour mixture to the butter-sugar mixture. Don’t overbeat it!
recipe.step4: With a rubber spatula, stir in the chocolate and cranberries until the dough is well mixed. With a 1 ¾ inch ice cream scoop* (or two spoons), scoop round balls of dough onto the prepared sheet pans. Sprinkle lightly with the sea salt.
recipe.step5: Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until nicely browned. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Madelines
recipes.subtitle: A beautiful, bite-size cake originated from France.

recipes.name: Gateau Basque
recipes.subtitle: A traditional cake originated from the Basque region of southern France.

recipe.step2: With your mixer, combine the butter and sugar. Add the almond powder, lemon zest, egg yolk and 1/2 egg. For the 1/2 egg, just whisk one egg and pour half in the mix. Add the flour and salt. Form a ball and let stand at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
recipe.step3: In the meantime, prepare the filling. Boil the milk in the pan – stir constantly. In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until the mixture whitens. Add the sifted flour to the bowl and whisk. Mix hot milk slowly into the bowl, then return to pan. Add almond extract. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Stir constantly (don't overheat!). Cook until creamy. Add rum. Place in bowl and set aside.
recipe.step4: Take the dough out of the fridge and divide it in half. Spread a half on a floured work surface with a rolling pin (non-stick is easier). This dough is very sticky, so be generous with flour!
recipe.step5: Rollout the top layer of the cake and set aside on a separate floured surface such as a cutting board (this will make it easier to place into the pan when needed).
recipe.step6: Cut out a disc the size of your pan for the bottom layer. Place inside the buttered pan and form out the edges. Pour the cream on the bottom of dough and a little jam in the center (if including). Dine top layer with egg using a food brush prior to placing on cake. Decorate with fork as desired. Carefully spread this layer over the cake. I use a spatula to slowly shift the layer from the cutting board onto the cake. Bake 30 minutes.
recipe.step7: Let cool before unmolding. The best is to wait 24 or 48 hours before serving.

recipes.name: Vanilla Bean Pear Cocottes
recipes.subtitle: Un-pearably delicious personal-sized cakes.

recipes.name: Beignets au Chocolat
recipes.subtitle: French donuts filled with hazelnut chocolate. Need I say more!?

recipe.step1: In the bowl of your stand mixer , pour the flour, sugar, milk, yeast, egg and oil. Mix with the hook on speed 1 for 5 minutes until combined. Add the butter and mix with the hook for 20 minutes at slow speed. Push out the bubbles in the dough with a fist. Spread the dough out.
recipe.step2: Form a ball with the dough by filming in contact then let it rise for 2 hours at room temperature.
recipe.step3: Using a round cookie cutter, form the donuts to have a round shape. Let rise again for 2 hours at room temperature.
recipe.step4: Pour sunflower oil into a large, thick-bottomed frying pan.
recipe.step5: Heat the oil to a 180°C, checking with a thermometer, then cook the donuts.
recipe.step6: Flip them over so that they cook evenly on both sides. Place the donuts on absorbent paper and then dip them in sugar.
recipe.step7: Using a pastry bag, insert the spread and taste.

recipes.name: Yellow Birthday Cake
recipes.subtitle: A sweet cake fit for any celebration!

recipes.name: Wild Turkey Dog Food
recipes.subtitle: Homemade food for your fur babies. Rich in protein, fiber, and binding to help with upset tummies.

recipe.step1: Boil the turkey meat until fully cooked. Set aside.
recipe.step2: Cook the peas and white rice per the bags' instructions. Set aside
recipe.step3: Mix the turkey meat, rice, peas, and white rice together. Allow to cool and serve!

recipes.name: Dog Cookies
recipes.subtitle: Homemade treats for your fur babies.

recipe.step1: Preheat oven to 350° F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat; set aside.
recipe.step2: In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat pumpkin puree, peanut butter and eggs on medium-high until well combined, about 1-2 minutes. Gradually add 2 ½ cups flour at low speed, beating just until incorporated. Add an additional ¼ cup flour at a time just until the dough is no longer sticky.
recipe.step3: Working on a lightly floured surface, knead the dough 3-4 times until it comes together. Using a rolling pin, roll the dough to ¼-inch thickness. Using cookie cutters, cut out desired shapes and place onto the prepared baking sheet.
recipe.step4: Place into oven and bake until the edges are golden brown, about 20-25 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool completely.

recipes.name: Dog Birthday Cake
recipes.subtitle: Homemade birthday cake to celebrate your fur babies.

recipe.step2: In a large bowl, combine flour and baking soda. In a separate bowl, mix together vegetable oil, peanut butter, applesauce and pumpkin puree. Once combined, mix in egg and mix until combined. Combine wet and dry ingredients and stir until combined.
recipe.step3: Pour mixture into an 8" round pan (a square pan can also be used) that has been greased with oil. Bake for approximately 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean and the cake springs back when pressed lightly.
recipe.step4: In the meantime, make the frosting. Place yogurt and tapioca starch in a small bowl and thoroughly combine. Mix in milk a teaspoon at a time until consistency of frosting.
recipe.step5: Once cake has cooled, apply frosting as desired. Allow frosting to dry before serving!
